sentence.text: Patient 2 also exhibited maxillar and severe mandibular hypoplasia and cleft palate, as well as a dislocation of the temporomandibular joint (Fig. 1b).
Because of airway problems, a tracheostoma was required.
She had bilateral microtia and dysplasia of the ears with atretic auditory canals.
On both sides, there was a synostosis of metacarpals IV and V.
Both hands had four rays, the morphology most likely corresponding to an aplasia of metacarpal I of the hands, and bilateral aplasia of the thumbs.
There was bilateral radial aplasia and ulnar hypoplasia (Fig. 2c, d).
The first finger was rudimentary duplicated on both sides (containing middle and distal phalangeal bones on the right hand, additional rudimentary proximal phalanx on the left-hand side).
The feet showed sandal gaps and small fourth toes, with an underriding fourth toe on the left (Fig. 3a).
Her psychomotor development was slightly delayed
